page.title: 10The Deer Museum, Torridon
page.content: The{DEER MUSEUM} near The Mains was started in 1971 by the National Trust for Scotland Ranger and has grown steadily from then.It is all his own work with exhibits of stag antlers, bones, skins and life styles of{red {deer,roe deer and fallow deer.}The red deer are most common in this area, with a few roe deer in the wooded part There are photographs, samples of parasites, examples of injuries, both accidental and by poachers;fences and fence wire are very hazardous to deer causing agonising injuries.Stalking controls deer numbers to the optimum the land can support;examples of the methods and equipment are on display. Pelts and photographs of other wild animals are also displayed.The museum which is extremely interesting is visited by many people.Admission 30p.{ {Live red deer}graze in a nearby field.
